value.halfverse: deliver me in your righteousness.
value.verse:
In you, O LORD, have I taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame; *

value.halfverse: make haste to deliver me.
value.verse: Incline your ear to me; *

value.halfverse: for the sake of your Name, lead me and guide me.
value.verse:
Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe,
for you are my crag and my stronghold; *
Take me out of the net that they have secretly set for me, *
value.halfverse: for you are my tower of strength.

value.verse: Into your hands I commend my spirit, *
value.halfverse:
for you have redeemed me,
 O LORD, O God of truth.

value.verse: I hate those who cling to worthless idols, *
value.halfverse: and I put my trust in the LORD.

for you have seen my affliction;
 you know my distress.
value.verse: I will rejoice and be glad because of your mercy; *
You have not shut me up in the power of the enemy; *
value.halfverse: you have set my feet in an open place.

my eye is consumed with sorrow,
 and also my throat and my belly.
value.verse: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; *

value.halfverse:
my strength fails me because of affliction,
 and my bones are consumed.
value.verse:
For my life is wasted with grief,
and my years with sighing; *

I have become a reproach to all my enemies and even to my neighbors,
a dismay to those of my acquaintance; *
value.halfverse: when they see me in the street they avoid me.

value.verse: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; *
value.halfverse: I am as useless as a broken pot.

they put their heads together against me;
 they plot to take my life.
value.verse:
For I have heard the whispering of the crowd;
fear is all around; *

value.halfverse: I have said, “You are my God.
value.verse: But as for me, I have trusted in you, O LORD. *
My times are in your hand; *
value.halfverse:
rescue me from the hand of my enemies,
 and from those who persecute me.

value.verse: Make your face to shine upon your servant, *
value.halfverse: and in your loving-kindness save me.”

value.verse: LORD, let me not be ashamed for having called upon you; *
value.halfverse:
rather, let the wicked be put to shame;
 let them be silent in the grave.
haughtily, disdainfully, and with contempt.
value.verse: Let the lying lips be silenced which speak against the righteous, *

value.halfverse:
which you have done in the sight of all
 for those who put their trust in you.
value.verse:
How great is your goodness, O LORD!
which you have laid up for those who fear you; *
You hide them in the covert of your presence from those who slander them; *
value.halfverse: you keep them in your shelter from the strife of tongues.

value.verse: Blessed be the LORD! *
value.halfverse: for he has shown me the wonders of his love in a besieged city.

Nevertheless, you heard the sound of my entreaty
 when I cried out to you.
value.verse:
Yet I said in my alarm,
“I have been cut off from the sight of your eyes.” *
Love the LORD, all you who worship him; *
value.halfverse:
the LORD protects the faithful,
 but repays to the full those who act haughtily.

value.verse: Be strong and let your heart take courage, *
value.halfverse: all you who wait for the LORD.
